item.value: set Window Monitor Interval

It's recommended that this generally either * matches or is half the value of requestExpiryTimeout. Therefore, at worst * a request would could take up 1.5X the requestExpiryTimeout to clear out. * @param windowMonitorInterval The amount of time to wait (in ms) between * executions of monitoring the window.
Sets the amount of time between executions of monitoring the window * for requests that expire.
Requests are not automatically expired unless monitoring was enabled * during construction of this window.
request never expires
A value < 1 is * assumed to be an infinite expiration
The amount of time (in milliseconds) that a * request will be set to expire after acceptance.
he amount of time to wait (in ms) before * an unacknowledged request expires. -1 disables.
Defaults to disabled (-1).
Set the amount of time to wait for an endpoint to respond to * a request before it expires.
set Request Expiry Timeout
set Connect Timeout
set Use Ssl
set Counters Enabled

a single instance of a client bootstrap can technically be shared // between any sessions that are created (a session can go to any different // number of SMSCs) - each session created under // a client bootstrap will use the executor and monitorExecutor set // in its constructor

Modified version of UTF-8 designed mostly for serialization and speed. The byte arrays it produces is NOT identical to UTF-8 but is safe to use for Java-to-Java serialization.
